Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        London Introduction to Television Writing    Program Overview Against the backdrop of a vibrant city, this 3-week program provides students with a foundational understanding of the dynamics of television writing. Classes are held at the University of London’s Senate House. Prerequisite: Tisch Film/TV Majors: Fundamentals of Dramatic & Visual Writing (FMTV-UT 0033) or Intro to Dramatic & Visual Writing II (FMTV-UT 0032) or Screenwriting II (FMTV-UT 0056) For Dramatic Writing Majors: Craft of Dramatic and Visual Writing (DWPG-UT 20) For all other majors or visiting students: EITHER Fundamentals of Developing the Screenplay (OART-UT 35) or Playwriting Practicum (OART-UT 1040) or equivalent experience. Program Curriculum Introduction to Television Writing IFMTV-UT 1017 4 units Instructor: D.B. Gilles This course will introduce students interested in TV writing to all aspects of what goes into the creation of a script for a TV program. The course prepares students for other TV-writing courses within the Kanbar Institute of Film and Television. This could be a great course for upperclassmen with an interest in television writing who haven’t previously taken other TV writing courses. For non-writers who wish to learn the fundamentals   of TV writing, this course serves as preparation for creating shows and working with   writers. Comedy Writing: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Comedy Writing for Film and Television  FMTV-UT.1158 Studio 4 Credits Course Level: Advanced (formerly Advanced Comedy Writing Workshop)      Prerequisite: Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing (H56.0033), or Dramatic & Visual Writing II (H56.0032), or Script Writing II (H56.0056). Starting Spring 2010, this course will require Writing the Short Screenplay (H56.1020) or Script Analysis (H56.1084). Course may be repeated.    In this course you will have the opportunity to write: comedy feature film, half-hour sitcom specs scripts, series of comedy sketches and stand-up comedy material. This intimate class is a writing workshop that explores every aspect of comedy writing for visual media. Whether it’s Larry David that does it for you, or the Brothers Farrelly, Marx or Coen, this course will help students discover what works, what doesn’t, and why. The last part of the semester will be devoted to the business of comedy writing – where the work is, who the players are. Industry guest speakers may visit throughout the semester. Research and Writing: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Research and Writing for Documentary  FMTV-UT.1118 Studio 4 Credits Course Level: Intermediate     Prerequisite: Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing (FMTV-UT 33), or Dramatic & Visual Writing II (H56.0032), or Script Writing II (H56.0056). Starting Spring 2010, this course will require Writing the Short Screenplay (H56.1020) or Script Analysis (H56.1084).    Research and Writing for Documentary (H56.1118) will examine the moral and ethical problems of documentary making; logistics and planning; research techniques and sources; choice of media and style. Each student will be expected to develop at least one idea into a project.
